intro: Stobaea echinopoda, commonly known as the spiny echinop, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a hairy, upright stem with narrow, gray-green leaves that have a rough texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the summer months. Stobaea echinopoda is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
